item.title: Bail applications surge amid pandemic
item.description: Prisoners seeking bail in Victoria’s County Court has more than doubled since last year as the coronavirus pandemic plays havoc with the state’s justice system.

item.title: Walker proud of NRL’s indigenous work
item.description: South Sydney five-eighth Cody Walker says the NRL has made significant steps forward in the indigenous space since a group of players met with league officials asking for the national anthem to be removed from the pre-season All-Stars game.

item.title: Jail for lighting eight Victorian bushfires
item.description: A man who lit eight bushfires requiring an “extraordinary” emergency services response will go to jail for a minimum of two years.

item.title: Five injured in Sydney bus crash
item.description: Two buses have collided on a busy Sydney street, leaving five injured.

item.title: End to crippling defamation payouts
item.description: Australia’s defamation laws will be amended to help end massive payouts, clear the country’s clogged courthouses and allow journalists to report more freely.

item.title: Local shares close trading day higher
item.description: Local sharemarkets ended Monday’s trading day higher, shaking off last week’s growing concern of rising US-China tensions.

item.title: Levi Manly’s key signing
item.description: Newcastle have lost three hookers to season-ending injuries and the man they released in Danny Levi is excelling at Manly as he looks to secure his long-term future.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to do this’, jury hears
Remorseful Mitchell raring to go
item.description: A remorseful and “raring to go” Latrell Mitchell can have a Greg Inglis-type influence for South Sydney when he returns from his two-game suspension, fittingly for Indigenous round against St George Illawarra on Thursday night.

item.title: ‘Justified’: Why masks don’t violate rights
item.description: Experts have quashed claims that being forced to wear a mask in public violates an individual’s human rights.
